title: Central Park Five
summary: Trump took out full-page ads calling for death penalty for five Black and Latino teenagers later exonerated by DNA. He refused to apologize even after exoneration.
keyFacts: Took out full-page ads in New York newspapers calling for death penalty
Five Black and Latino teenagers accused of attacking jogger in Central Park
All five were later exonerated by DNA evidence in 2002
Refused to apologize even after exoneration
As late as 2016, still suggested they were guilty despite DNA evidence
Netflix documentary 'When They See Us' brought renewed attention to the case
